context: "Olla" is the Estonian verb "to be". It's used to express existence or a state of being, similar to English "am/is/are/was/were". In the examples shown: "Olen heas tujus" means "I am in good mood", "Tema oli kodus eile" means "He/she was at home yesterday", and "Me oleme head sõbrad" means "We are good friends".
